page.title: 17Finchingfield School 1985.
page.content: Our school was built in Victorian times about 130 years ago.It used to have separate sides for girls and boys with even a wall down the middle of the playground. Nowadays it is divided into three classes by age.There are about seventy children who come from the village, Cornish Hall End and a few Americans from the Air Base. The day starts at 8.45 with a break at 10.30 for 15 mins.The dinner hour is from noon to 1.30.Afternoon break is at 2.30 and school ends at 3.30. We do Mathematics and language work.Topic work is also important as we go out on trips to nature reserves, museums,archaelogical digs and also many places in the village itself. We go swimming once a week and play football,netball,rounders,gym volleyball and cricket.
